Startup Week

Startup School


Sep 28 - Oct 5, 2013
NYC
Twitter • Facebook

What is Startup Week?

What is Startup Week? Startup Week is our trademark week of hacking, networking, demo-ing and learning from the best and brightest in NYC tech. Every semester, we invite founders, investors, and technologists to share their passions with thousands of students.

Our theme this year is "Startup School" and we will be exploring how technology is disrupting various industries like fashion, music, finance, and investing.

Who's Speaking?

  • Keynote with Josh Kushner

    • Monday 9/30

      Google HQ
      RSVP
    • 7PM
      Josh Kushner is a partner and managing director at Thrive Capital, and a successful entrepreneur, having founded Vostu in his junior year at Harvard. Most recently, he raised $40m to found OSCAR, a startup that's aiming to disrupt the insurance industry.

  • Disrupting Fashion, Music and Media

    • Tuesday 10/1

      KMEC 1-100
      RSVP
    • 5:30 PM
      Madison Maxey is a Thiel fellow and the founder of CRATED.
    •  
    • 6:30 PM
      Eric Davich is the co-founder of Songza
    •  
    • 7:30 PM
      Jason Baptiste is the CEO and founder of Onswipe.

    • Wednesday 10/2

      Courant 109
      RSVP
    • 6:30 PM
      Chris Muscarella is the CEO and co-founder of Kitchensurfing.

      Alex Taub is the Business Development Director of Dwolla.

  • Lessons in Venture Capital

    • Thursday 10/3

      Vanderbilt 208
      RSVP

    • Friday 10/4

      RSVP
